Comment.Content: Developer Express built something similar to this for Microsoft for VS2008 "CodeRush Xpress for C#". It's a cut down version of the CodeRush/Refactor product, but it's free and it contains some of the "Declare from Use" stuff from the commercial product. It also uses the smart naming heuristics from the full product so it should offer more reasonable names. It should coexist in VS with resharper in case you want to test out a different implementation of similar functionality.
Comment.Author: richard morris
Comment.AuthorUserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.1b4) Gecko/20090423 Firefox/3.5b4

Comment.Content:
Hi Richard:
Thank you. I did check CodeRush Xpress for C#. It's good and it's free. I just wanted to see what was in the box on 2010.
Comment.Author: @Richard Morris
Comment.AuthorUserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.0.10) Gecko/2009042316 Firefox/3.0.10 (.NET CLR 4.0.20506)
